author: Garth Ogle

text:
Oh? So you have introduced yourself to some NIS games afterall? This saved me from the trouble of asking it on some unrelevant video. 

This is my favourite game series ever, by the way. Or actually a game series by my favourite game developer company. Tenpei Sato is such a great composer. 

Running Fire was a theme that surprised me a bit. It didn't seem to fit the game's music profile at all, but I like it. 

... man, now the nostalgia's pouring all over me...

author: BYERE

text:
Disgaea: Hour of Darkness was SOOO much better than the first. Can't say much about the 3rd game as I haven't played it...

And yes... it pretty much is about grinding your way through multiple levels (mostly in Item World to level up items to make them better)
author: BYERE

text:
The only game in this series I played was 2, though I didn't like it very much. I heard this was a lot better.

On the other hand, I also heard that all the games are basically about grinding the hell out of your characters, which doesn't really appeal to me.

text: still catchy on the DS, though. all in all, I think they did a fantastic job on the DS port. It was more a problem of space then capability. they had to make cuts to some of the voice overs and music quality just to fit the hole game on that small cartridge.
